title: Getting Started with ggaib
text: ggaib package provides ggplot2 themes color scales Annenberg Institute Brown University. includes four theme variants discrete, continuous, diverging color scales using Institute’s brand palette.
code: library(ggaib) library(ggplot2)

title: Getting Started with ggaib
text: Access full palette select specific colors:
code: aib_colors() #>      navy       red   emerald    yellow       sky     taupe     brown      gray  #> "#1B3E6F" "#C00404" "#00AF9A" "#EBA900" "#55C8E8" "#B6B09D" "#503629" "#97A3AE" aib_colors("navy", "red", "emerald") #>      navy       red   emerald  #> "#1B3E6F" "#C00404" "#00AF9A"

title: Getting Started with ggaib
text: four core themes included ggaib pacakge, optimized different use case. themes share base font color palette, differ gridline axis styling suit different types visualizations.

title: Getting Started with ggaib
code: set.seed(42) districts <- data.frame(   spending = c(rnorm(40, 11, 2), rnorm(40, 15, 2.5), rnorm(40, 13, 3)),   avg_score = c(rnorm(40, 250, 15), rnorm(40, 270, 12), rnorm(40, 258, 18)),   urbanicity = rep(c("Urban", "Suburban", "Rural"), each = 40) )  ggplot(districts, aes(spending, avg_score, color = urbanicity)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib() +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("dollar")) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20)) +   labs(     title = "Per-Pupil Spending and Math Achievement",     subtitle = "Simulated school district data",     x = "Per-Pupil Expenditures\n($1,000s)",     y = "Avgerage Math Score",     color = "Urbanicity",     caption = "Note: Simulated data for illustration"   ) +   theme_aib()

title: Getting Started with ggaib
code: set.seed(42) years <- 2005:2023 gap_data <- data.frame(   year = rep(years, 2),   group = rep(c("Higher-Income", "Lower-Income"), each = length(years)),   score = c(     270 + cumsum(rnorm(length(years), 0.3, 0.8)),     240 + cumsum(rnorm(length(years), 0.8, 0.9))   ) )  ggplot(gap_data, aes(year, score, color = group)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   scale_color_aib() +   scale_x_continuous(     breaks = seq(2005, 2025, 3)   ) +   scale_y_continuous(     limits = c(215, 300),     breaks = seq(200, 300, 20)   ) +   labs(     title = "Reading Achievement Gap Over Time",     subtitle = "4th-grade scores by household income",     x = NULL,     y = "Average Reading Score",     color = NULL   ) +   theme_aib_grid()

title: Getting Started with ggaib
code: enrollment <- data.frame(   type = c("Traditional\nPublic", "Charter", "Magnet", "Private"),   students = c(47.3, 3.7, 2.5, 5.7) ) enrollment$type <- factor(enrollment$type, levels = enrollment$type) enrollment$students <- enrollment$students * 1e6  ggplot(enrollment, aes(type, students, fill = type)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_aib() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma")) +   labs(     title = "U.S. K\u201312 Enrollment by School Type",     x = "Sector",     y = "Enrollments"   ) +   theme_aib_slide() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Getting Started with ggaib
code: set.seed(42) states <- ggplot2::map_data("state") spending_by_state <- data.frame(   region = unique(states$region),   spending = runif(length(unique(states$region)), 7, 24) ) map_df <- merge(states, spending_by_state, by = "region")  ggplot(map_df, aes(long, lat, group = group, fill = spending)) +   geom_polygon(color = "white", linewidth = 0.2) +   scale_fill_aib_c() +   labs(     title = "Per-Pupil Spending by State",     fill = "$ (1,000s)",     caption = "Note: Simulated data for illustration"   ) +   coord_fixed(1.3) +   theme_aib_map()

title: Getting Started with ggaib
code: set.seed(42) schools <- data.frame(   enrollment = runif(80, 200, 1500),   avg_score = rnorm(80, 260, 20),   st_ratio = runif(80, 10, 30) ) schools$avg_score <- schools$avg_score - (schools$st_ratio - 20) * 1.5  ggplot(schools, aes(enrollment, avg_score, color = st_ratio)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib_c() +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma"), breaks = seq(0, 1500, 300)) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20)) +   labs(     title = "Student-Teacher Ratio Across Schools",     x = "Enrollment",     y = "Avg. Test Score",     color = "Student-Teacher\nRatio"   ) +   theme_aib() #> Warning: Removed 3 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

title: Getting Started with ggaib
code: set.seed(42) districts2 <- data.frame(   enrollment = runif(80, 500, 5000),   avg_score = rnorm(80, 255, 20),   spending_change = rnorm(80, 0, 6) )  ggplot(districts2, aes(enrollment, avg_score, color = spending_change)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib_div() +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma"), breaks = seq(0, 5000, 500)) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20)) +   labs(     title = "Year-over-Year Spending Change",     x = "Enrollment",     y = "Avg. Test Score",     color = "Spending\nChange (%)"   ) +   theme_aib() #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andrew Camp. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Camp (2026). ggaib: ggplot2 Themes Annenberg Institute Brown University. R package version 0.1.0, https://andrewmcamp.github.io/ggaib/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ggaib: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University},   author = {Andrew Camp},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://andrewmcamp.github.io/ggaib/}, }

what: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
title: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
text: ggplot2 themes color scales Annenberg Institute Brown University.

title: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("andrewmcamp/ggaib")

title: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
code: library(ggaib) library(ggplot2)  aib_colors() #>      navy       red   emerald    yellow       sky     taupe     brown      gray  #> "#1B3E6F" "#C00404" "#00AF9A" "#EBA900" "#55C8E8" "#B6B09D" "#503629" "#97A3AE"

title: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
text: four core themes included ggaib pacakge, optimized different use case. themes share base font color palette, differ gridline axis styling suit different types visualizations.

title: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
text: minimal, publication-quality theme gridlines clean axis lines.
code: set.seed(42) districts <- data.frame(   spending = c(rnorm(40, 11, 2), rnorm(40, 15, 2.5), rnorm(40, 13, 3)),   avg_score = c(rnorm(40, 250, 15), rnorm(40, 270, 12), rnorm(40, 258, 18)),   urbanicity = rep(c("Urban", "Suburban", "Rural"), each = 40) )  ggplot(districts, aes(spending, avg_score, color = urbanicity)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib() +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("dollar")) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20)) +   labs(     title = "Per-Pupil Spending and Math Achievement",     subtitle = "Simulated school district data",     x = "Per-Pupil Expenditures\n($1,000s)",     y = "Avgerage Math Score",     color = "Urbanicity",     caption = "Note: Simulated data for illustration"   ) +   theme_aib()

title: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
text: theme_aib() light gray major gridlines data-dense plots.
code: set.seed(42) years <- 2005:2023 gap_data <- data.frame(   year = rep(years, 2),   group = rep(c("Higher-Income", "Lower-Income"), each = length(years)),   score = c(     270 + cumsum(rnorm(length(years), 0.3, 0.8)),     240 + cumsum(rnorm(length(years), 0.8, 0.9))   ) )  ggplot(gap_data, aes(year, score, color = group)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   scale_color_aib() +   scale_x_continuous(     breaks = seq(2005, 2025, 3)   ) +   scale_y_continuous(     limits = c(215, 300),     breaks = seq(200, 300, 20)   ) +   labs(     title = "Reading Achievement Gap Over Time",     subtitle = "4th-grade scores by household income",     x = NULL,     y = "Average Reading Score",     color = NULL   ) +   theme_aib_grid()

title: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
text: Larger text spacing, optimized slides.
code: enrollment <- data.frame(   type = c("Traditional\nPublic", "Charter", "Magnet", "Private"),   students = c(47.3, 3.7, 2.5, 5.7) ) enrollment$type <- factor(enrollment$type, levels = enrollment$type) enrollment$students <- enrollment$students * 1e6  ggplot(enrollment, aes(type, students, fill = type)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_aib() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma")) +   labs(     title = "U.S. K\u201312 Enrollment by School Type",     x = "Sector",     y = "Enrollments"   ) +   theme_aib_slide() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
text: axes, ticks, gridlines. Retains title caption styling.
code: set.seed(42) states <- ggplot2::map_data("state") spending_by_state <- data.frame(   region = unique(states$region),   spending = runif(length(unique(states$region)), 7, 24) ) map_df <- merge(states, spending_by_state, by = "region")  ggplot(map_df, aes(long, lat, group = group, fill = spending)) +   geom_polygon(color = "white", linewidth = 0.2) +   scale_fill_aib_c() +   labs(     title = "Per-Pupil Spending by State",     fill = "$ (1,000s)",     caption = "Note: Simulated data for illustration"   ) +   coord_fixed(1.3) +   theme_aib_map()

title: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
code: set.seed(42) schools <- data.frame(   enrollment = runif(80, 200, 1500),   avg_score = rnorm(80, 260, 20),   st_ratio = runif(80, 10, 30) ) schools$avg_score <- schools$avg_score - (schools$st_ratio - 20) * 1.5  ggplot(schools, aes(enrollment, avg_score, color = st_ratio)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib_c() +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma"), breaks = seq(0, 1500, 300)) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20)) +   labs(     title = "Student-Teacher Ratio Across Schools",     x = "Enrollment",     y = "Avg. Test Score",     color = "Student-Teacher\nRatio"   ) +   theme_aib() #> Warning: Removed 3 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

title: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
code: set.seed(42) districts2 <- data.frame(   enrollment = runif(80, 500, 5000),   avg_score = rnorm(80, 255, 20),   spending_change = rnorm(80, 0, 6) )  ggplot(districts2, aes(enrollment, avg_score, color = spending_change)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib_div() +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma"), breaks = seq(0, 5000, 500)) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20)) +   labs(     title = "Year-over-Year Spending Change",     x = "Enrollment",     y = "Avg. Test Score",     color = "Spending\nChange (%)"   ) +   theme_aib() #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

title: Annenberg Institute Brand Colors — aib_colors
text: Returns named character vector hex color codes Annenberg Institute brand palette. Pass color names select specific colors.

title: Annenberg Institute Brand Colors — aib_colors
code: aib_colors(...)

title: Annenberg Institute Brand Colors — aib_colors
text: ... Color names select. empty, returns colors.

title: Annenberg Institute Brand Colors — aib_colors
text: named character vector hex color codes.

title: Annenberg Institute Brand Colors — aib_colors
code: aib_colors() #>      navy       red   emerald    yellow       sky     taupe     brown      gray  #> "#1B3E6F" "#C00404" "#00AF9A" "#EBA900" "#55C8E8" "#B6B09D" "#503629" "#97A3AE"  aib_colors("navy", "red") #>      navy       red  #> "#1B3E6F" "#C00404"

title: AIB Font Family Names — aib_font
text: Returns registered font family name given role. font system prefers locally installed brand fonts falls back Google Fonts alternatives via showtext.

title: AIB Font Family Names — aib_font
code: aib_font(role = c("heading", "body", "serif"))

title: AIB Font Family Names — aib_font
text: role One "heading", "body", "serif".

title: AIB Font Family Names — aib_font
text: character string font family name.

title: AIB Font Family Names — aib_font
code: aib_font("heading") #> [1] "Albert Sans" aib_font("body") #> [1] "Source Sans 3"

title: All AIB Font Families — aib_font_families
text: Returns named list font family names roles.

title: All AIB Font Families — aib_font_families
code: aib_font_families()

title: All AIB Font Families — aib_font_families
text: named list elements heading, body, serif.

title: Axis Label Formatters — aib_label
text: Convenience wrapper returns label functions common axis formats. returned function can passed directly labels argument scale_*_continuous() call.

title: Axis Label Formatters — aib_label
code: aib_label(type = c("comma", "dollar", "percent", "pp"))

title: Axis Label Formatters — aib_label
text: type Label type. One "comma", "dollar", "percent", "pp" (percentage points).

title: Axis Label Formatters — aib_label
text: labeler function suitable ggplot2::scale_x_continuous() ggplot2::scale_y_continuous().

title: Axis Label Formatters — aib_label
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(data.frame(x = 1:5, y = seq(1000, 5000, 1000)), aes(x, y)) +   geom_col() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = aib_label("dollar")) +   theme_aib()

what: Annenberg Institute Color Palette Function — aib_pal
title: Annenberg Institute Color Palette Function — aib_pal
text: Returns function generates n colors AIB brand palette. Intended use inside ggplot2 scale functions.

title: Annenberg Institute Color Palette Function — aib_pal
code: aib_pal()

title: Annenberg Institute Color Palette Function — aib_pal
text: function takes integer n returns n hex color codes.

title: Annenberg Institute Color Palette Function — aib_pal

what: ggaib: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University — ggaib-package
title: ggaib: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University — ggaib-package
text: Provides ggplot2 themes color scales following visual identity Annenberg Institute Brown University. Includes publication, presentation, map, data-dense theme variants plus discrete, continuous, diverging color scales using Institute's brand palette.

title: ggaib: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University — ggaib-package
text: Maintainer: Andrew Camp andrew_camp@brown.edu

title: Register AIB fonts — register_aib_fonts
text: Checks locally installed preferred fonts. found, registers Google Font fallbacks via sysfonts enables showtext rendering. Falls back "sans" roles font registration fails (e.g., required packages like jsonlite unavailable).

title: Register AIB fonts — register_aib_fonts
code: register_aib_fonts()

title: Discrete AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib
text: Maps categorical variables Annenberg Institute brand palette. Colors ordered maximum visual contrast.

title: Discrete AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib
code: scale_color_aib(...)  scale_colour_aib(...)

title: Discrete AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib
text: ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale().

title: Discrete AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib
text: ggplot2 discrete color scale.

title: Discrete AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() +   scale_color_aib()

title: Continuous AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_c
text: Creates continuous color gradient two brand colors. Defaults navy--sky gradient.

title: Continuous AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_c
code: scale_color_aib_c(low = "#1B3E6F", high = "#55C8E8", ...)  scale_colour_aib_c(low = "#1B3E6F", high = "#55C8E8", ...)

title: Continuous AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_c
text: low Color low end gradient. Default AIB navy. high Color high end gradient. Default AIB sky. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::scale_color_gradient().

title: Continuous AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_c
text: ggplot2 continuous color scale.

title: Continuous AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_c
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = hp)) +   geom_point() +   scale_color_aib_c()

title: Diverging AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_div
text: Creates diverging color gradient. Defaults red-gray-navy.

title: Diverging AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_div
code: scale_color_aib_div(   low = "#C00404",   mid = "#D0D0D0",   high = "#1B3E6F",   midpoint = 0,   ... )  scale_colour_aib_div(   low = "#C00404",   mid = "#D0D0D0",   high = "#1B3E6F",   midpoint = 0,   ... )

title: Diverging AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_div
text: low Color low end. Default AIB red. mid Color midpoint. Default light gray. high Color high end. Default AIB navy. midpoint data value mapped midpoint color. Default 0. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::scale_color_gradient2().

title: Diverging AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_div
text: ggplot2 diverging color scale.

title: Diverging AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_div
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = hp - mean(hp))) +   geom_point() +   scale_color_aib_div()

title: Discrete AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib
text: Maps categorical variables Annenberg Institute brand palette fill aesthetics.

title: Discrete AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib
code: scale_fill_aib(...)

title: Discrete AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib
text: ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale().

title: Discrete AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib
text: ggplot2 discrete fill scale.

title: Discrete AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), fill = factor(cyl))) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_aib()

title: Continuous AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_c
text: Creates continuous fill gradient two brand colors.

title: Continuous AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_c
code: scale_fill_aib_c(low = "#1B3E6F", high = "#55C8E8", ...)

title: Continuous AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_c
text: low Color low end gradient. Default AIB navy. high Color high end gradient. Default AIB sky. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::scale_fill_gradient().

title: Continuous AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_c
text: ggplot2 continuous fill scale.

title: Diverging AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_div
text: Creates diverging fill gradient. Defaults red-gray-navy.

title: Diverging AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_div
code: scale_fill_aib_div(   low = "#C00404",   mid = "#D0D0D0",   high = "#1B3E6F",   midpoint = 0,   ... )

title: Diverging AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_div
text: low Color low end. Default AIB red. mid Color midpoint. Default light gray. high Color high end. Default AIB navy. midpoint data value mapped midpoint color. Default 0. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::scale_fill_gradient2().

title: Diverging AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_div
text: ggplot2 diverging fill scale.

title: Annenberg Institute Base Theme — theme_aib
text: minimal, publication-quality ggplot2 theme following Annenberg Institute Brown University visual identity. Uses brand fonts automatic Google Fonts fallback.

title: Annenberg Institute Base Theme — theme_aib
code: theme_aib(   base_size = 11,   base_family = NULL,   gridlines = c("none", "x", "y", "xy") )

title: Annenberg Institute Base Theme — theme_aib
text: base_size Base font size points. Default 11. base_family Override base font family. NULL, uses registered AIB body font. gridlines major gridlines display. One "none" (default), "x", "y", "xy".

title: Annenberg Institute Base Theme — theme_aib
text: ggplot2::theme() object.

title: Annenberg Institute Base Theme — theme_aib
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point() +   theme_aib()   # Add horizontal gridlines ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point() +   theme_aib(gridlines = "y")

title: Annenberg Institute Grid Theme — theme_aib_grid
text: Identical theme_aib() defaults gridlines = "xy" light gray major gridlines. Use data-dense plots gridlines aid readability.

title: Annenberg Institute Grid Theme — theme_aib_grid
code: theme_aib_grid(   base_size = 11,   base_family = NULL,   gridlines = c("xy", "x", "y", "none") )

title: Annenberg Institute Grid Theme — theme_aib_grid
text: base_size Base font size points. Default 11. base_family Override base font family. NULL, uses registered AIB body font. gridlines major gridlines display. One "none" (default), "x", "y", "xy".

title: Annenberg Institute Grid Theme — theme_aib_grid
text: ggplot2::theme() object.

title: Annenberg Institute Grid Theme — theme_aib_grid
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point() +   theme_aib_grid()

title: Annenberg Institute Map Theme — theme_aib_map
text: theme spatial/map plots axes, ticks, gridlines. Retains title, subtitle, caption styling.

title: Annenberg Institute Map Theme — theme_aib_map
code: theme_aib_map(   base_size = 11,   base_family = NULL,   gridlines = c("none", "x", "y", "xy") )

title: Annenberg Institute Map Theme — theme_aib_map
text: base_size Base font size points. Default 11. base_family Override base font family. NULL, uses registered AIB body font. gridlines major gridlines display. One "none" (default), "x", "y", "xy".

title: Annenberg Institute Map Theme — theme_aib_map
text: ggplot2::theme() object.

title: Annenberg Institute Map Theme — theme_aib_map
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point() +   theme_aib_map()

title: Annenberg Institute Slide Theme — theme_aib_slide
text: Optimized presentations larger text spacing. Default base size 16pt.

title: Annenberg Institute Slide Theme — theme_aib_slide
code: theme_aib_slide(   base_size = 16,   base_family = NULL,   gridlines = c("none", "x", "y", "xy") )

title: Annenberg Institute Slide Theme — theme_aib_slide
text: base_size Base font size points. Default 11. base_family Override base font family. NULL, uses registered AIB body font. gridlines major gridlines display. One "none" (default), "x", "y", "xy".

title: Annenberg Institute Slide Theme — theme_aib_slide
text: ggplot2::theme() object.

title: Annenberg Institute Slide Theme — theme_aib_slide
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point() +   theme_aib_slide()
